benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to payment

covered: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios verify 204 with valid payloads and headers (TC01–TC04, TC14, TC15, TC16, TC17, TC20).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404 when the payment does not exist (TC06).
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent requests scenario checks consistency and performance (TC19).
Input Validation: Invalid UUID format (TC05), missing required header (TC07), missing/malformed body (TC08–TC10), and unexpected properties (TC16).
Server Error Handling: Simulated DB failure returns 500 (TC12).
Performance/Large Payloads: Very large arrays and payload size with response-time expectations (TC14, TC20).
Integration Consistency: Follow-up GET reflects updates (TC17).
gaps: PUT - Partial Update Semantics: No explicit test establishes whether PUT replaces the entire set of custom fields vs merges (full-replace vs merge). TC04/TC16/TC18 allow multiple outcomes instead of asserting the contract.
Empty Array Behavior: TC04 is ambiguous (“removed or remain unchanged”). The expected behavior for empty array must be asserted (e.g., remove all fields).
Idempotency: No scenario replays the same PUT twice to verify idempotent behavior and unchanged state on repetition.
Same-Resource Concurrency: TC19 covers concurrency generally but not race conditions on the same paymentId (e.g., last-write-wins or optimistic locking behavior if applicable).
Content Negotiation/Headers: No tests for missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., 415) or Accept headers; story specifies application/json consumption.
Response Contract for 204: No validation that the response body is empty and headers are correct (e.g., Content-Type absent/consistent for 204).
Error Contract: 400/404 bodies are not validated against a defined error schema (fields like code, message).
Optional Audit Headers Behavior: Presence is tested (TC02) but not that Reason/Comment are recorded in audit/history.
recommendations: Add definitive tests to assert PUT semantics: confirm full replacement of the custom fields set vs merge behavior, including explicit empty array meaning (remove all vs no-op).
Add an idempotency test: repeat identical PUT and verify no additional changes or side effects.
Add same-resource concurrency tests: two concurrent PUTs to the same paymentId; verify deterministic outcome or versioning behavior.
Add content negotiation tests: missing/wrong Content-Type -> 415; invalid Accept -> 406 (if enforced).
Tighten expected outcomes: replace “204 or 400 as per API behavior” with concrete expectations for duplicates and extra properties per API contract.
Validate 204 response contract: assert no response body and appropriate headers.
Validate error schema for 400/404/500: assert structured error fields (code, message, details).
Audit verification: after PUT with Reason/Comment, query audit logs/history to confirm values are recorded.
